content:
Hello, I'm Windows user and not familiar with Mac, but I'd like to know how to install Lean 4 on MacOS.
I have some questions about easy way to install.
I have M1 MacBook. How to install Lean 4 on MacOS says that installing Lean on M1 Mac is complex, but it seems that I can install Lean 4 in the same way as quickstart page in Lean manual, namely, first install VS Code, then Lean 4 extension, then "Install Lean using Elan" button.
My question is, assuming that Mac does not have any previous Lean 4 or 3 installed,

  • On M1 Mac, is it OK to install Lean 4 in this way (via VS Code and Lean 4 extension)?
  • Also is it possible to install Lean 4 in this way on Intel Mac? (I don't have Intel Mac, but I heard that installing in this way did not succeed, so I guess people should follow instructions on How to install Lean 4 on MacOS?)

By good timing I happened to be looking for an easy way to install Lean 4 on an ARM Mac, and found your posting. I tried the quickstart and it also worked fine for me, and I've been able to run the Mathematics in Lean tutorial. As far as I can tell everything is running natively. So this does seem to be the best way to get started on ARM Macs now--perhaps the documentation should be updated?
I have installed it manually starting from elan and in the way you suggest on my ARM macs and also for me, in all cases, it has worked perfectly fine.

@Haruhisa Enomoto I believe the "Quickstart" method is supposed to work on both M1 and Intel Macs. It might be helpful to the maintainers if you report your success/failure with it here ... also could you say where you heard that it doesn't work for Intel Macs?
tsuki hao has marked this topic as resolved.

@Alistair Tucker
He said there was an error when downloading lean in vscode (but could be a network issue), and instead followed the instruction on How to install Lean 4 on MacOS (Intel Macs).

As this topic was resolved, I suppose it is usually recommended to use VS Code extension for installing Lean 4 on Mac OS. I'll teach this way to other Mac users, and will raise question again if installation fails.
